name: Hotel Jazz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Really liked the Jazz - it's modern without looking like it's furnished by Ikea, and the location is perfect - a 5 min walk and you're at the top of Las Ramblas. There was some rumble from the metro (we were on 4th floor) but not enough to disturb us. Rooms were clean and well furnished, and staff really friendly and helpful - especially when one of our party was taken ill. From the airport take the Aerobus to the Universitat stop - the hotel is 2 mins away. Shame it rained so much as Barcelona is a beautiful city. Do visit the Gaudi houses - Casa Batllo is stunning, and the roof of La Pedrera is amazing. Sagrada Familia is quite awe inspiring. We also visited Parc Guell - it's easy enough on the Metro (cheap as chips and simple to navigate) - go up to Vallcarca and the park is 600m away. Be warned though - the last half of that is up a steep slope. There are escalators going up most of the way, but you have to come down via the steps/slope. Well worth the visit, although the area around the main entrance was really busy. The old cathedral in the gothic quarter is lovely too - and has it's own geese. We used Bus Turistic - E23 for a 2 day pass and a good way to see the city. The Aquarium was a bit disappointing - not great value for money and apart from the penguins have seen most things either at London or Birmingham aquariums. If you're a student take your NUS card to get discounts on entrance fees. Had nice dinner at MamaCafe on C de Doctor Dou (El Raval) - chilled out atmosphere and good food at reasonable prices. One thing to watch is for no-smoking signs at cafes - we went into one for breakfast and everyone was smoking - some have banned smoking but it is still the norm. Cafes on Las Ramblas are v expensive - approx £6 for a diet coke - but a good place to watch the world go by. Some of the "pet" stalls on Las Ramblas are not for the faint hearted - way too many animals packed into small cages. Hold on to your bags - we were all OK but it's easy to see how pickpockets make their money. And keep an eye out for the parakeets flying around the city! Visit the Boqueria market just off Las Ramblas - the fruit and veg in particular is an amazing sight. All in all, a good trip, despite poor weather and illness. Would definitely recommend the Hotel Jazz as a nice hotel in a good position - and the pool is fabulous - a little oasis.
reviews.title: Fab Hotel

It was not the type of place we were looking for had the staff listened to us. Couldn't help but think that the hotel probably got a huge kickback for sending us there! reviews.title: What a perfect base.
reviews.text: You must try this gem of a base in Barcelona. We have just returned from 3 nights at the Hotel Jazz in Barcelona and adored it. Our booking was influenced by previous reviews and everything written by previous guests was spot on. Modern does not mean uncomfortable - it was a real departure from our usual choice of hotel but were not disappointed. Fabulous location near to all public transport - the very efficient metro only few yards away (very easy to use - purchase T10 ticket for 6.75 Euro in metro station and share between all members of party just by re-inserting into machine on metro or bus), multitude of buses passing in all directions and the heart of the city so close on foot. There are several eating places in close proximity and great shops too. The airport bus even goes to and from Placa de Catalunya (outside El Cortes Ingles Department Store)every few minutes and is only 3.75 Euro each way - and is again only a short walk away from the hotel. Otherwise taxi from airport to hotel is approx 25 Euro. City taxis are numerous and inexpensive too. The hotel is most comfortable, great beds and plumbing, and so clean with fast efficient lifts. There is also a free safe in the room. The noise of the busy city can easily be shut out by closing the balcony double glazed doors and if you think the faint rumble of the metro will bother you then request a 7th floor top room to help minimise this. The roof top seating area is pleasant, breakfast offers a good choice to suit everyone and the staff are most helpful.There is also a luggage room if you have a late flight. All in all a great base to explore a fantastically vibrant and diverse city. We would also add that if you like football,a trip to see FC Barcelona play at the Camp Nou is definitely worth arranging as we did - tickets can be delivered to hotel to await your arrival on various web sites and it is only 6 stops by metro from hotel.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

Jazz, Barcelona - great base to visit a great city
reviews.text: A great value for money, modern, clean, central hotel in Barcelona. Would def recommend and stay there again. Really close to the 'easy and cheap to use' metro in Universitat square (where there is also a taxi rank and tour bus stop). Reception really helpful and catered for our special requests. Great views from the roof aswell (where there is a sun terrace and pool). Along with the usual free shampoo & shower gel they also provide free razor, toothbrushes, sponge, comb and sewng kits! LCD tv in the room with mainly spanish stations but you can also get Sky, BBC world and National geographic. Traffic quite noisy outside if balcony door open and you can feel the rumble of the metro beneath you but nothing to put you off staying there (just make sure you ask for a high floor (floor 7 being the highest). Walking to Ramblas takes less than 5 mins and every other attraction is really easy and central to get to from here. Not a paticularly large hotel but very good value for money (cheapest rate I got was booking direct from their web site) for such a central hotel.

reviews.text: It was a mother and daughter weekend, with the daughter arriving from New York early in the morning and the mother at noon from Milan. We had booked a 3 day Winter Sales Package, which included a bottle of champagne upon arrival and daily breakfast. I had asked the hotel if my daughter could check in early and they did not promise that the room would be ready. But when she arrived, since the standard room that we had reserved was not ready, she was upgraded to a junior suite for free! We had a lovely large space divided in two by a half wall, with a flat screen tv in front of the bed and a couch on the other side. If you do not like contemporary architecture and design, pick another hotel. I love it, so I felt perfectly at home surrounded by linear furniture, black, brown and white decor, and a new clean wooden floor that felt so much nicer than the worn out carpets that usually cover hotel room floors. Black and white photos of jazz playing instruments hands decorate the walls of the hotel and of the rooms.

reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights with my boyfriend to celebrate our 3 year anniversary in Barcelona and the hotel exceeded out expectations. Having heard that city centre hotels are not as clean as those on the outskirts, I was a bit wary but I needn't have worried!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are friendly and helpful. Check-in was swift and hassle-free. It literally took us 5 minutes to check-in. Maid service was excellent. The hotel is spotlessly clean with modern decor and I have no complaints at all about the room or en suite.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel and city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My only 'whinges' (which is an overstatement) are:
reviews.title: Great hotel at a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Second stay here and we won't stay anywhere else now in Barcelona. Great value, great location, clean, modern, comfortable with the added bonus of a small pool on the roof to cool you down after a hot days exploring.
reviews.title: Back again
Great experience
reviews.text: It just does everything you want a city centre hotel to do

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great and convenient location. The staff is wonderful!
reviews.title: great hotel and great location
Will return
reviews.text: Rooms are clean and modern, my only complaint would be the beds being a little hard.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Other than that, look no more, you found really nice accommodations.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location but a bit expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We just returned from a 3 night stay at Hotel Jazz following a cruise on the WindSurf. I chose the Jazz based on the excellent recommendations here.
reviews.title: Amazing Value in a Great Location

likes.liked: — Great location, very clean, free high-speed Internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: All of us (we had two rooms) couldn't have been more pleased with the hotel. We arrived early on a Sunday morning, and asked to get into our rooms early. The desk clerk offered us rooms on the third floor, but had nothing at that time on higher floors. The only big negative in reviews was feeling the subway rumbling (and it seemed that only those below the fourth floor felt the rumbling), so I chose to wait for rooms on a higher floor. They stored our bags for us, and we waited on comfortable sofas in the lobby (where we did feel the subway rumbling under us). After about an hour (around 10:30 am) there were rooms available on the fourth floor for us. On the fourth floor, none of us ever noticed any noise or rumbling during our stay.
reviews.title: Jazztastic!!
Not much Jizz in the Jazz
reviews.text: One room faced the street, and one faced the courtyard. With windows closed, both rooms were extremely quiet and we all slept well. The beds are comfortable, and everything was very clean. The rooms were a bit small, but very comfortably arranged - and a great value for the 105 euros we paid for a double room (with queen bed).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008
reviews.text: We didn't have breakfast at the hotel (it didn't look interesting) but there is a snack bar next to the hotel entry, and a Starbucks less than a block away. I have to confess that I really enjoyed Starbucks after a couple weeks of European coffee! So I ran for Starbucks and pastries every morning - fine for breakfast. The only negative during our stay was trying to drink our Starbucks at a table next to the bar while waiting to use the PC - the restaurant staff was quite nasty in telling us to get out (despite the restaurant being totally empty).
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar was nice for a quiet nightcap after dinner - but definitely not a swinging hot spot. If I was looking for nightlife in Barcelona, it seems to me that any hotel bar would be a boring choice! The pool was closed due to cool and rainy weather, but it looked like it would be nice.
reviews.title: Just the job

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In one word: GREAT. We stayed in the hotel from 30th April till 3th May. We arrived late in the evening and it was just as we expected from this website and the website of the hotel. The room was very spacious, alot of light, good airconditioning and very clean.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, great pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was great, with a good working shower, everything was very clean and all the needed equipment was available. Enough towels, that were freshened every day.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on the 2nd floor so we could lightly here the metro passing, but you had to listen very well to even notice it. Besided that the rooms were very quiet.
reviews.title: Great Location, Large room, Loved the pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also loved the pool on the rooftop, after a warm day of walking through the city it was great to enjoy a fresh dip in the pool and the great view that came with it.
reviews.title: "Excellent"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't use the breakfast because we found it too expensive and for half of the price you could get a very good breakfast across the street at "D'Or" or "Viena".
reviews.title: Great location, great stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and i stayed at the hotel jazz on the 24th march and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is in a perfect location 2 minutes from the Ramblas and just outside a main subway station, it is central for everything. The hotel is really modern and clean and is more like a 4 star than 3 star. The only complaint I would have is that our room was facing the main road and was quite noisy..you can also hear the subway (we were on floor 2) but we were well prepared with earplugs and it is a city after all.. (request an high floor)..other than that it was perfect and Barcelona is fantastic!!
reviews.title: fantastic hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Picked this hotel for its no-smoking policy and the TA reviews. Very convenient to airport bus, Ramblas, Metro, although we walked almost everywhere other than when we took the Tourist Bus. Would have appreciated conditioner (someone else mentioned that too.) Decor so dark that room felt a little cave-like, but since we were out and about it didn't matter too much. No noise problem, bathroom new and sparkling clean, bed acceptably comfortable (never did get used to those long skinny Spanish pillows, tho), and the staff very friendly and helpful. Good internet access.
reviews.title: Would definitely return to Hotel Jazz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Wife and I spent 4 nights in March at The Jazz Hotel. It's our second stay and we love the Jazz. You can get on the Metro (Universitat Station)without crossing the street. Lovely rooftop pool and free internet access. Tasteful modern design and quiet confortable rooms. Be sure and ask for coupons for free drinks at the nearby Celler de Tapas.
reviews.title: Love the jazz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my boyfriend here for a romantic weekend away and I cannot fault the place! Usually my boyfriend always has some small complaint about something and even he could not fault it. I booked the hotel directly through their website and mentioned that it was our anniversary and when we arrived (it's very easy to find once you have your landmarks sorted!) they had upgraded us for free to a Junior Suite! It was amazing. We had three huge doors that opened out (we were on the 3rd floor) so we had a great view on the hustle and bustle of below. We didn't hear any street noise that bothered us other than the RAC that have sirens like police cars.
reviews.title: absolutely perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast ran until 11am and they have a good selection and a real toaster (not many places seem to have these nowadays!) and the coffee is good (although if you like starbucks there is one very close by)
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel and location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located a stone's throw from the Placa de Catalunya, this 3 star hotel looks and feels more like a 4 star. Modern decor and light spaces mean it feels spacious, staff are extremely friendly and professional and it is immaculately decorated throughout with large rooms and bathrooms. The breakfast provides more than sufficient options for most people (this is probably the part that is 3 star rather than 4) and the quality of the food was fine. You can explore the Rambla, Port and Eixample areas easily on foot and shops, bars, restaurants and transport links are all nearby. The windows onto the balcony are also well sound proofed, so even though it is on a busy street, the noise level is minimal. The swimming pool on the roof is a nice added bonus and for less than £100 per night, I wouldn't search any further for a hotel in the city.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Perfect for Exploring Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Jazz does it for me! We paid 101 Euros per night for 4 nights from April 1 to 5 at this hotel. This did not include breakfast but it doesnt bother me, we never like eating in hotels anyway. We stayed at Room 606. We checked in early and they were able to put us up in the room. The hotel is located by the Universitat Metro stop at Plaza Catalunya. This location cannot be beat. You are 5 mins away from the Ramblas. I don not recommend staying along the Ramblas at all. From this location you can walk everywhere. There are other hotels in this area such as Chic and Basic Tallers (we stayed here for one night see my review on this) , Hotel Inglaterra which just faces Hotel jazz. Enough of the location, its great first time tourist location.
reviews.title: It was simply FABULOUS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very modern and contemporary when you walk in the lobby. The room they gave us was simply BEAUTIFUL. Other than the hotel in Munich, I don’t think I have stayed in such a beautiful room. Its like a one bedroom apartment minus the kitchen. It had 4 balconies, yes 4, it was all around. You walk in a hallway then you see a sitting room where there is a couch and a chair and a small desk with two chairs. A gray wall partitions this to the bedroom area and bathroom. Oh how I wanted to stay longer. The room itself is perfect 10. You want space, you got it! It really puts even the Park Hyatt rooms or Four Seasons Rooms to shame.
reviews.title: Good 3* hotel in Central Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Now about the noise, we were on the sixth floor and you really cannot hear the metro, maybe in the still of the night and you are really listening to it. I am an extremely light sleeper and on the weekends, Friday and Saturday night, you will hear people screaming in the streets and just plain old drunk. This was the only noise that I heard, I guess the soundproofing cannot take care of that. I just used my earplugs. But this will not deter me from staying at this hotel at all.
reviews.title: One of the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There is a complimentary computer on the second floor that you can use. There are only 2 and I swear you have these young English girls who use these computers to check out their myspace or facebook pages and pictures etc. I had to say something one time coz it was very inconsiderate. They were there for like half an hour and on both machines.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights and paid £71 per night room only. Breakfast is an extra €15 per person and is a tad overpriced for what you can get.
reviews.title: Cool Style in Centre of town

likes.liked: — The modern decor, the fittings and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007
reviews.text: The reception area is very austere but our room was great. We got an upgrade to a junior suite. The colour themes of the Jazz might take some getting used to but we found it to be fine. The bathroom was kitted out with black marble tiles throughout and white porcelain. It had both a separate shower and a bath with a shower. Plenty of towels. The beds were firm and comfortable. There's a minibar (not too expensive) but no hot beverages in the room.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is exceedingly well situated for the centre of activity in Barcelona, just a couple of blocks from Placa de Catalunya but far enough away from the noise of the Ramblas. There's some traffic noise even through the double glazing and you can hear the rumbleof the Metro trains as far as the sixth floor but unless you're really very fussy about sound these won't disturb you.
reviews.title: All that Jazz

likes.disliked: — no Tea/Coffee making facilities in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If arriving by bus from the Airport (€3.90) dismount at Universitat as this stop is less than 2 mins walk from the hotel. The service is quick and easy.To return by bus it's necessary to go Placa de Catalunya. The are many sights to be seen in Barcelona and the 'Bus Turistico' covers most of these in 2 separate 2hr long circuits from Placa de Catalunya (€19 or €23 if spread over 2 days).
reviews.title: Modern Jazz

likes.disliked: — Our drunk neighbor, shouting at 2am in the corridor the first night :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar shuts at midnight at weekends, 11pm other days. This is a 3 star hotel and there's no night porterage.
reviews.title: Great Choice

likes.disliked: — Lack of in room tea making facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very contemporary hotel (think the "W" hotel style)located just off the famous Ramblas. Our room was well laid out, comfortable and spotless. It was well priced for the location.
reviews.title: Great hotel in excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a mini bar, flat screen tv , plentiful towels and nice toiletries. Great beds and pillows. Quiet with interior courtyard.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Helpful, courteous staff who spoke fluent English.
reviews.title: Clean, Comfortable and Central, but something missing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights following a short cruise which ended in barcelona. The hotel was easy to find, maybe 5 mins walk from the top end of the Ramblas. The hotel is very modern and fairly minimalistic in decor. The staff were English speaking and friendly. Although we arrived at 9.30am, they had a room for us by 10am. The room was spacious, good king size bed and blackout curtains. There is a great (small) pool on the roof terrace with views around barcelona and it was empty on the first day. By the second day the pool area was busy, but there were still seats/loungers. We got a late checkout no problem. We didnt try the room service/bar, but the maid service was accomodating with the time the room was made up.
reviews.title: great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel. Despite being a 3*, it has all we typically find in a 4*.
reviews.title: Close to Ramblas

likes.disliked: — underground noise up till the 4th floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Jazz hotel for a couple of nights and cannot fault it. It is very clean and modern with a really nice comfortable bed and the location is great for seeing the sights of Barcelona which is a wonderful city, The staff were very polite and attentive. Would definitely stay here again if we return to Barcelona.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.disliked: — Internet very slow or did not work at all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Theresa and Peter
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

likes.liked: — Modern look, tile everywhere, close to attractions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: You cant go wrong, close to everything, stayed one night, very clean, very friendly staff.
reviews.title: quiet and subdued hotel in good location
can't go wrong!
reviews.text: Spotless but characterless hotel in good location near the metro and open top bus stops. Hotel itself was very quiet but there was alot of road noise at night if the windows were open (we were on the 7th floor). The hotel is situated between two main roads.There were no coffee or tea making facilities in the rooms and we couldn't get any from room service in the mornings as it doesn't open until 1pm! The bar was very quiet and shuts early (midnight). I didn't go to the pool as there is so much to see in the city I didn't have time. I think the hotel is over priced considering the lack of facilities (£140 per night for a twin roon - no breakfast) but I have been told that Barcelona is pricey. Barcelona is an amazing place to visit and I will definately return (you don't have time in a long weekend to see everything) but I will not return to this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: can't say enough about this hotel. booked through british airways and got a good deal with an unbeliveable full breakfast included. was concerned about the coffee as a few people mentioned the coffee was not up to par. as a starbucks fan, i found the cafe con leche delicious and a great way to start the day. we,( my husband and i, both 50) consider ourselves somewhat hip and very well traveled. as architects, we found the jazz to be just what we were looking for. a small, clean, beautifully designed and furnished hotel. location was perfect., right off the ramblas. we walked everywhere, yet if you are not up to it public transportation is a stone's throw away. room was spacious. great comfortable king size bed. tv with cnn news. staff was helpful and courteous. rooftop deck and pool were a nice retreat in the late afternoon. barcelona is an incredible city and if you are thinking about the jazz, you can't go wrong!
reviews.title: So quiet
Hotel Jazz
reviews.text: We had a great overnight stay near the heart of Barcelona at the Hotel Jazz. It was clean, comfortable, modern and stylish. The location was excellent--just a block or two from Las Ramblas and right in the middle of a bustling neighborhood full of shops and restaurants. The staff was pleasant, easy to understand and very professional.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: Friendly, clean, nicely located - great hotel. I'd highly recommend this hotel above most four star hotels. Really enjoyed my stay and will definitely use this place again. The rooftop pool and bar are a particularly nice touch.
reviews.title: Best 3 star I've ever stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: This is a great compromise hotel between price and quality...
reviews.title: Highend three star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot think of anything which qualifies this as a 3 star instead of a 4.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room (quiet if windows closed), bed, bathroom, breakfast, were all just as good if not better than many other four star experiences i've had, and add to this the benefit of the roof top cafe bar and (modest) pool.
reviews.title: Great spot, nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: At $165 per night it was a great comparative value as we had stayed one night at a sister hotel, U232 and were disappointed there.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Value, Staff and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was clean and bright and we had a small balcony. The lobby is chic/stylish and the staff very helpful (they spoke good English). The staff provided excellent city information and materials as well as restaurant referrals (The Cellar de Tapas around the corner is out of the world yummy!). The location is perfect, a short walk to all of the action on Las Ramblas (strolling/shopping area). We did not do the breakfast, it was extra and we felt expensive. Wireless services work well and internet is available downstairs if you are without laptop. It must be nice in warm weather on their roof pool!
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely return to this hotel!
reviews.title: Almost Everything Was Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel after reading reviews on TripAdviser and my son and I were not disappointed. The hotel is indeed superbly located, not just given its location at the top of La Rambla but also because of the nearby metro stations at Universitat (got us effortlessly to the Camp Nou for the Real Madrid game) and Catalunya. Note also that the airport bus (A1) terminates a few minutes away in Plaza Catalunya - so you can get to the airport for just €3.50 each way. The room was simple but comfortable and well-appointed. Service was good (no problems to access a PC to print off online boarding passes) and the noise from the streets was tolerable.
reviews.title: great hotel

likes.liked: — very stylish for the price range
likes.disliked: — snackbar restaurant not really operationally beyond breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Of course the breakfast at €15 is over-priced, but why would anyone eat at the hotel with so many cafés nearby? We had coffee and pastries in nearby bars for a fraction of the price.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in the middle of all the action

likes.liked: — Price. Close to restaurants, bars, cafes, clubs, shopping, airport bus access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel directly through the hotel website after reading the reviews at tripadvisor. Is a nice hotel, centrally located. Paid avg €155 without breakfast during the Easter holidays. Rooms were clean and large enough for this city. Cannot complain about anything. Did not have breakfast at the hotel. There are many cafes nearby for same, so it is not worth spending €15 for breakfast. Though we did order morning tea thru room service €2 each. Would recommend this hotel to everyone. We were in room 718, looking into the narrow courtyard. The hotel has a roof top pool, which must be great during the summers.
reviews.title: God Hotel in the heart of Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel, booked after trawling through hundreds of hotel reviews & was not disappointed. Great location, very clean, stayed in room 501, didn't hear the metro, room spacious, towels cleaned daily. Huge bed, plenty storage & safe for valuables. Only downside was hubby found shower over bath quite tight (could be due to him being over sized). Don't know if they have rooms with seperate showers. If you need large fluffy towels take your own though. I found the staff very helpful, english speaking, great with advice on services etc.
reviews.title: Fab break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancee and I stayed here for three days after staying at the much ritzier Hotel 1898 for four days. The hotel was clean, mostly quiet and centrally located.
reviews.title: Good overall value hotel

likes.disliked: — The thermostat did not seem to work properly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008
reviews.text: We were there in February so there were no families with kids, although the signs in the elevator seemed to indicate that there are kids around at other times of the year.
reviews.title: Service SOSO with the exception of Anais!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If we hadn't stayed at 1898 first we probably would have rated this one excellent. The underground pool and spa at 1898 really spoiled us.
reviews.title: Fab Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was good as Hotel Jazz is right in the city center by las ramblas. It is close to the gothic quarter and el raval, as well as l'example. The rooftop with a bar and pool was picturesque, I wish we could have taken advantage of it more! The hotel itself was modern and clean, and the rooms were a comfortable size. Service was decent but definitely did not "wow" me - like others have mentioned, the people at the desk weren't overly warm or hospitable. The one thing I was disappointed in was that upon my last night staying here I returned to the room wearing a certain pair of my shoes, and then in the morning packed my belonings and flew to another city in Spain. Upon my arrival there I opened my suitcase to find that one of the shoes was not there in my suitcase. I immediately contacted Hotel Jazz to explain the situation and see if they had it, and they replied that they did not. I have no doubt the shoe was left behind given the logistics of the situation, and therefore must assume it was tossed, perhaps with idea that I wouldn't have been able to retrieve it. Funny enough, family members were staying at Hotel Jazz a few days later and could have picked up the shoe left behind. This experience lessened my satisfaction with our stay at Hotel Jazz.
reviews.title: Good value, experience dampened by not being able to retrieve item left behind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall however, I would recommend this hotel because of the cleanliness, location, and value. Just be more diligent than me in checking all corners of your room when leaving!
reviews.title: A very good Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I liked the hotel very much: central location, good breakfast, swimming pool and bar on the roof, quickly and very friendly service. I advise it to everybody. There is undeground station near the hotel, a lot of shops and cafes around.
reviews.title: Great Location
Fantastic Location and Terrific Value
reviews.text: The hotel is located between the Las Ramblas district and Exemplar, great access to both without the chaos of Las Ramblas or the high price of Exemplar. The rooms are fairly large and well appointed. Situated within a block of two metro stations so it was easy to travel to any attraction in the city within minutes (the metro is very easy to navigate, you can get a free app at the apple store). The rooftop pool area is a very relaxing spot for an evening cocktail or snack at a reasonable price. The hotel is starting to fray a little at the edges, some scrapes and nicks in the hallways and rooms, but overall in excellent condition.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The young men at the front desk were most helpful and very friendly, one even told us which floor of the nearby department store to look for certain items.
reviews.title: great location and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night pre cruise - as suggested on this site asked for a room on a high floor - request met by hotel - could just hear distant rumble of metro but no problem. Room and service excellent - had breakfast at the hotel which was reasonable value for the wide choice available but if you only want a juice, coffee and a croissant go out. Staff at the desk very pleasant and helpful and e mail facility useful. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel on the basis of Trip Advisor reviews. Everything lived up to very high expectations. We had a problem with the shower which was fixed very quickly. No other complaint on any aspect.
reviews.title: Everything they say is right

likes.liked: — Highest quality furnishings, small hotel with guests treated as important individuals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cafe D'Or opposite was first stop and also lived up to expectations.
reviews.title: Great Location, highly recommend!

likes.disliked: — If you want to take the bus tour (red line), take the stop at Universtat before it reach Plaza Catalunya stop as there will be LOTS of ppls queuing in Plaza Catalunya stop waiting to get on the tour bus.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recommend bus trips to assess the city and what's on offer. Fellow guest was robbed by very pushy flower girl. She was as efficient as a street magician - literally right before his eyes. Local advice is push and kick them away.
reviews.title: Very Nice Barcelona Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like seafood you are spoiled for choice of highest quality. Don't like seafood ? you won't enjoy a culinary experience.
reviews.title: The Best!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We selected Jazz Hotel based on the reviews that we read from the TripAdvisor website. We were not disappointed. it was a great hotel. 5 mins walk from La Rambla and Catalynya Plaza. Near enough and yet away from the crowd.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, family adored it
Absolutely Loved the Hotel Jazz!
reviews.text: The design is contemporary, the room sizes generous and the bathroom big and clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Jazz for 4 days, left some bags in the luggage room, and check out to explore Sevilla and Granada before returning to Barcelona and re-checking in to Jazz. On the return leg, it felt like coming home. It really felt that cosy.
reviews.title: Hotel Jazz is all you need to know where to stay in Barcelona!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I can't say enough about our experience with the Hotel Jazz. This is a great modern hotel in a fantastic location. The team at Reception were pleasant and very helpful. The rooms are immaculate and very modern and the beds were very comfortable. We didn't opt for the breakfast since there are many choices in the surrounding area. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel in Barcelona.
reviews.title: Excellent location; amazing bathroom!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Thanks to the reviews from Tripadvisor, we decided to book this hotel, mainly due to its location and price.
reviews.title: Super hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007
reviews.text: great location. nice modern decor. very clean and comfortable room. There is only one little thing to improve- the shower head should not be installed above the middle of the narrow tub. You have to stand either in the front half of the tub, where some of the space is taken up by a towel rack, or the rear half, where there isn't much room to stand with the curb of the tub. This is more a review for the hotel. It's just a minor discomfort. I would strongly recommend it to fellow travelers.
reviews.title: good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Jazz for four nights in August 2006. We booked our room based on tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed - all the positives and negatives reflected on tripadvisor were there.
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Jazz is conveniently located within a few blocks of metro and a major square. We had no trouble finding it after stumbling off our plane into Barcelona.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel in a great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very clean and modern. The windows eliminate nearly all street noise. Our bed was comfortable. The maid service was respectful and did good work. The concierge was very helpful and spoke great english - all our special requests were met.
reviews.title: Beds not great here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a nice bar and restaurant with good food. The rooftop bar was cool and well attended.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

likes.liked: — The views fronm the rooftop terrace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've just returned from a four-night stay at the Hotel Jazz, and I'd definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Barcelona for a few days.
reviews.title: Great location and price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008
reviews.text: We booked our stay through the hotel and got an even better rate than was available on the website. The four nights for us both cost about 510 euro, including the 7% tax.
reviews.title: Comfortable, friendly Hotel Jazz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The real selling point for the Jazz is the location. It's between the Place Catalunya at the top of the Ramblas, and Place Universtat.
reviews.title: Not for the light sleeper

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ramblas is less than five minutes walk away, and it's possible to walk most places. During our four days, we never used the metro, and only took a taxi once (in search of a restaurant that proved not to be worth the trek!) We also used the open-top tour buses two days, and other than that we walked every where.
reviews.title: Wonderful bedroom, great breakfast, very central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008
reviews.text: There's no need to pay 150 euro each for breakfast. We ate on two mornings in a little bar/tapas place across the road (I think it was Biere D'Or) and other mornings just picked little cafes off the Ramblas - and about 10 euro should cover two people.
reviews.title: Best location, nice modern hotel

description: An unbeatable location in the heart of Barcelona, between Plaza Catalunya, Paseo de Gracia, and the famous Ramblas, has made Hotel Jazz into one of the city’s most cosmopolitan hotels.A magnificent outdoor pool and a spacious terrace make the hotel a unique and spectacular spot for relaxing in the city center, and grant guests easy access to the city’s historical attractions and Gaudí’s modernist architecture throughout the neighborhood of the Eixample.
